snippet: Members of the security forces say that they lack basic supplies to fight the militants and that they feel abandoned by the government.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah reported from Kandahar, and Alissa J. Rubin from Kabul. Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and an employee of The New York Times contributed from Kunduz.
byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and ALISSA J. RUBIN

abstract: Afghan officials report Taliban is engaged in multifront attack in southern part of country even as group is also in midst of widespread northern offensive; say strategy is straining resources of Afghan security forces.
lead_paragraph: Members of the security forces say that they lack basic supplies to fight the militants and that they feel abandoned by the government.

headline.print_headline: Afghan Forces Straining to Repel Taliban Attacks
headline.main: Afghan Soldiers, Besieged by Taliban, Say They Are Outgunned
